channel.title: [C4D] DVDs
channel.description:
I noticed this section is going through one of those dead phases, so I'll spice it up.
Just a little something I made for something else I'm working on.
[img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/dvds.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/games.jpg[/img]

item.title: [C4D] DVDs
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Well I’ve got a render farm up at school (around 40 PCs) but I can’t use it until I get into VFX3** clases, and I’m in VFX2** classes.

The sad thing is the students are using the farms for some of the shittiest renders I’ve ever seen, and I’m using my little farm for stuff I’m not even doing for school.

I’ve got a small render farm in my house, but I’m not using it right now because I’m not ready for the final renders. Normally these renders I’ve been posting here take 1-2 hours, and the last 4 of them I’ve rendered today have been 15 minutes each (holy shit).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You need the facilites they use in Hollywood. IIRC, they have 100 pcs (200 cores) just to render a HD movie. And it still takes hours.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] DVDs
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:24, topic:268483”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=354327.msg2719709#msg2719709 date=1237906241]
this render took 32 hours
[/quote]
Seriously? The green looks a bit like the original Xbox case.
Still an Epic Picture.[/quote]

Yeah I thought I had it right and started rendering.
About 5 hours into it I found a case in my house and it’s much brighter. I can’t make mine much brighter though, otherwise it’ll glow.

The real time culprit here was AA. I cranked it up to about -1/6 instead of 0/2 like normal, and forgot that high AA settings KILLS render times with DOF enabled because it goes fucking crazy trying to organize and correct stuff that shouldn’t be.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] DVDs
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Ok I had to fake the green shader a little. And then I realized the real material is just a little weird.

I couldn’t do too much else to it or you’d see how I faked it.

But I cranked up all the important settings a little too high for this one and this render took 32 hours. I just didn’t have the heart to stop it lol.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] DVDs
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah I meant that the skate 2 box looks really stretched, i guess due to the camera barrel distortion or what not.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] DVDs
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

The box looks different to me than the rest because of the angle it’s at, it kinda looks like it was printed on felt that why I was asking.

The disc, it isn’t. But I think I see why you see that. Does it look darker right next to the part of the disc that seems to float, kinda like a shadow?

If that’s what you’re talking about, it’s a trick of the brain. The VrayForC4D logo is righttt there and it’s lighter than the rest, which makes the empty space inside the logo look darker that it should be, making you think it’s a shadow.

Whew.

And if you mean stretched then you are correct. I’m using a pretty wide lens. I only really notice it when one of the windows is on the far left or right of the screen, then it looks a lot longer than the other one and the half moon at the top looks like a long ass banana.

Read full topic
